definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: KNEEL】She knelt down to pull weeds from the flower bed.
sentences.chinese: 他跪下拔去花壇中的雜草。

sentences.english: Over 900 students kneed down in only several seconds.
sentences.chinese: 短短數秒時間，900多名學生跪下。

sentences.english: Make Mo to also follow to generally bend down, kowtow.
sentences.chinese: 弄墨也跟着一般的跪下，磕頭。

sentences.english: I knelt down and kissed her sweet, warm face.
sentences.chinese: 我跪下，親親她那的甜美，溫暖的臉。

sentences.english: Yin knelt, and noticed someone else kneeling beside him.
sentences.chinese: 殷志跪下，然後看到自己身邊也跪了一個人。

sentences.english: Then kneel, resting one knee on the floor.
I am sure this picture of Mr. Reid kneeling in prayer was taken at one of Calvary's camps or retreats.
sentences.chinese: 李牧師跪下祈禱的照片是在夏令會或退修會拍下。

sentences.english: She went to the coffin, very soft, and kneeled down and looked in.
sentences.chinese: 她輕輕地來到棺材前面，跪下去往裏看了一看。

sentences.english: I knelt down and he spoke to me.
sentences.chinese: 我雙膝跪下，他還對我說話。

sentences.english: If we are not pleased anymore, even the most arrogant tyrannies should get down on their knees.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們都不高興了，再傲慢狂暴的政府也得跪下。

sentences.english: She knelt down to pull weeds from the flower bed.
sentences.chinese: 他跪下拔去花壇中的雜草。

sentences.english: Is it lovey-dovey stuff, do you need a bit of rough? Get on your knees.
sentences.chinese: 它是可愛且溫柔的東西，你能粗魯嗎？跪下懺悔吧。

sentences.english: Michael knelt next to her and scooped her into his arms.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾挨着她跪下，一下把她攬入懷裏。

sentences.english: He had him ride in a chariot as his second-in-command, and men shouted before him, "Make way! ""
sentences.chinese: 又叫約瑟坐他的副車，喝道的在前呼叫說，跪下。

sentences.english: When I go to the temple to pray, he lightly holds my hand and kneels with me.
sentences.chinese: 同我去廟裏求籤，輕輕捉住我的手一同跪下。

sentences.english: Thus some churches encourage worshipers to kneel as part of the liturgy.
sentences.chinese: 因此有些教會鼓勵敬拜者在禮儀中跪下，以示尊敬。

definition: to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel/to go down on one's knees
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
to bump one's head/to kowtow with head-banging on the ground
